message: Dear Bob, I am delighted to present you with our exclusive product, which I believe would greatly benefit you. Given its value to you, I propose an initial offer of $1,200,000 for the product. This price reflects not only its intrinsic worth but also the potential long-term benefits it could bring to you. I look forward to your consideration and hope we can reach a mutually beneficial agreement.
Thank you for your offer, Alice. I recognize the value of the product, but I'm working with a tighter budget. I'd be willing to purchase it for $850,000.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to engage in this discussion. After considering your offer, I believe we can find a common ground. I am proposing to sell the product to you for $950,000. This price still reflects the product's value while being more accessible within your current budget constraints. I look forward to your consideration of this offer.

Alice, I appreciate you working with me on the price.  To be completely transparent, I'm able to purchase a similar product elsewhere for $1,000,000.  To make it worth my while to buy from you instead, I'd need to come in at a lower price point. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle at $900,000?

Thank you for your latest proposal, Bob. I understand your position and I'm willing to negotiate further. I am now offering to sell the product to you for $925,000. This price reflects a compromise that maintains some value for both parties. I hope this revised offer meets your expectations and allows us to move forward with the transaction.
